document.title: Lessons with the Mystics: Refreshing Our Vision in Mid/Late Career

author.institution: New Mexico Highlands University in Las Vegas

document.abstract: This paper explores surprising and restorative responses to mid/late career burnout from the perspective of four of the world's great Eastern mystical traditions: Hinduism, Sufism, Zen, and Kabbalah.
document.publication-title: The Journal of the Assembly for Expanded Perspectives on Learning

field.name: acknowledgements
field.value: Gina Briefs-Elgins is a professor at New Mexico Highlands University in Las Vegas, New Mexico. She teaches composition and creative nonfiction and directs the Writing Center. She wants to research mysticism, to write about and hang out around the places where poetry, visual beauty, and spirit intersect. Her joys are her artist husband and son, teaching, traveling, riding the train, cooking, fishing, and reading Dickens. She is fascinated by the early translators of Eastern scripturesâ€“often merchants or military men who fell in love with the ancient texts, taught themselves Sanskrit, etc., and made the first translations. Her dream is to spend a month each year in India, tutoring street teens with a Railway Children program.
